9.24.17  10:36 am   If you had lived your entire life enjoying apples, but then you one day ate a pear and very much enjoyed it, which one would you enjoy better? Would it be the apple, as you have had it all your life and it is blasphemous to change up your ideals? Or would you say the pear tastes better as it changes up the formula?
9.24.17  10:34 am   From a of 1 to 10, how lonely are you right now?

9.24.17  9:44 am   Am I a part of the universe?

      Sometimes I feel as if I am but a trespasser. One who observes and tries to watch and understand, but does not contribute. The universe placates me into complacency and boredom through shallow joys and entertainments. My friends placate each other to avoid negative emotions. Best to do nothing at all than to risk doing something bad. But a deep part of my soul stirs itself and yearns for more. I'm thinking of running away from this toxic environment and learning to play an instrument or some sort of art or something-anything- to contribute to the beauty around me. But I'm scared to take the first step. Beaten into being afraid of making even the smallest misstep. Afraid of the unknown. I want to dive into the universe rather than stay as a passive observer, but I still don't understand it well enough to find a path on my own. And I don't want to follow the footsteps of another, or I will be constantly comparing myself to them and replacing my old rules and rigidity with a new set. How do I be myself or know what I like if I have no idea what either of those things mean?

     How to test if something is me, or if something is what I like?

     My whole world is soulless and unresponsive, how do I pick up a personality without just copying others?

9.23.17  10:48 pm   You know that feeling when you hear a little phrase in a song that gives you goosebumps?

       I've always wanted to write/play something so good that i give myself the chills, and i have never been able to do it. Sometimes when playing with a band it's happened to me, like when everything just clicks and everyone in the group is really reading each other and you can feel that connection (like sometimes when improvising or 'jamming' i get that feeling like i know exactly what my bassist and drummer are about to do, and they know exactly what i'm about to do, and it's magical)...

     but i think that's more about that feeling of unity, than the sound itself.

     Like if somebody were recording it and played it back, i don't know if i'd still get goosebumps.

       But never when i'm just playing by myself, or working on a recording, have i been able to give myself chills, and i've always kind of viewed that as a 'litmus test' of my songwriting/playi ng abili ty.

     So far, it's a test i've failed. But i don't know if that's because it's impossible to do to yourself....

     Have you ever given yourself goosebumps with your own playing/writing in any of your songs?

      Is it even possible to give yourself the chills?

      I'm happy with the songs i've written, but i feel like i'm still searching for that elusive little phrase.
